author: Ak Pandey
comment: Trying to use

author: John Niles
comment: Could really use an overturned bedding symbol. Otherwise, super useful for doing casual geology, or to quickly produce stereonets from measurements.

author: Jabulani Matsimbe
comment: Among the giants on the market. Very useful and easy to use. Cheers!!

author: pui OSK
comment: in geological field works, this app makes me happy with accurate and precise of rock orientation.i love it
title: very useful

author: Muhammad Fharid
comment: Nice strike dip
title: Nice

author: Paul Grobbelaar
comment: Please add waypoint averaging in future updates. Even if it is in the paid version and add ability to save to google account or dropbox. Would make app perfect.
title: Waypoint averaging

author: Karine Tan
comment: Indispensable app for any geologist. Makes fieldwork 100× easier for me since it's an all in one app. Purchased version is totally worth it.
title: Lifesaver

author: Tolawak Oli
comment: RC
title: Driller

author: Scott Briscoe
comment: I've really enjoyed this app.  I've tested it multiple times with my Brunton and been within a few degrees in strike and tenths in dip as long as you wave the phone around for a bit to calibrate it.  Extremely happy.  Now just need to be able to export coordinates as UTM nad83.
title: Very useful

author: Will Falm
comment: To all recording modes.  I personally will use dip and strike for a traverse,  would be nice to have a button to take a quick camera shot (without to much previewing) with its filename saved as current gps coordinates.  *Edit* field move seems to be able to provide the in line picture function already and just seems to be a lot more intuitive than rock logger, I'm guessing it will just be a matter of time before it surpasses in other manors too y the look off its development.
title: Why not integrate camera

author: A Google User
comment: This app should be on every geo's phone! I hate taking pen and paper notes in the field, but Rocklogger has changed everything... I've taken hundreds of records by this point, and it's brilliant if you are aware of the limitations of your device. Just watch out if you have a flip case with a magnetic fastener in it, and calibrate often. The only downside (not the apps fault!) is that you're more likely to put your nice phone near rocky outcrops, I trashed my old phone by dropping it face-down on a nice sandstone outcrop. Totally worth it though.  Also, this app makes stereonets fun.
title: Indispensable!

author: Pradip Gawas
comment: Ability to give code or ID to each reading within a traverse will be great rather than having date and time as heading. Also multiple photos attached to the same ID will be added plus.
title: Change heading name

author: Felipe Oliveira
comment: I've used it on a field trip, taking pictures with coordinates, plotting them on a map... It helped me a lot. Open the map with a good internet connection and then go to your trip, no chance at all to get lost.
title: Really useful

author: A Google User
comment: great app but on my Atrix the tick marks for dip direction are facing the wrong way?  Update... fixed thank you!
title: great but ....

author: İlkay Çevik
comment: Very good application for geologists but projection datum should be changeable like ED50, WGS84 etc.
title: Datum should be changeable

author: Jeff Poole
comment: Easy to use and very useful in the field Being able to save and email data is excellent.
title: Useful App

author: Richard Whitmarsh
comment: Get "unlocked" and integrate with Google Earth; it's pretty awesome!
title: Great App :-)

author: Anjon Biswas
comment: it not instilled
title: poor

author: Rabindra Kumar Sinha
comment: Good
title: Good

author: Jaka Frianto
comment: nice for geologist

author: A Google User
comment: As a geologist, I was thrilled to find this app, turning my Droid2 into a quick electronic strike & dip measurement tool. I wouldn't recommend using any phone compass for professional measurements yet, but this app is great for making quick measurements that so far seem pretty good. The updates have been significant improvements that reflect good quality. Keep up the great work!!
title: Great app for geologists!

author: Jurgen Fitschen
comment: For measuring axial planes one should have the option to record the information at trend/plunge. Other than that this is an amazing app! Well Done!
title: AXIAL DATA

author: nicole ilic
comment: This is a great tool for use in the field, and saves heaps of time on data processing back in the office. Especially like the feature to export to google maps and see stereonets in the field without all the old school time consuming plotting!
title: An invaluable tool for any field geologist!

author: A Google User
comment: I wish I had this last week, when the client was spending too long under an unstable wall taking dodgy readings with a plastic Suunto. Oh, just a note to developers on the Quick Help. Help should tell us how to use the app. I think anyone who downloads this app would already know what dip and dip direction mean. Thanks.
title: Excellent app

author: A Google User
comment: Dip measurements are very precise, but azimuth or strike values differ a lot, hence cannot be used. The way you hold the phone (landscape vs portrait) seems to make a big difference. Tested on a Nexus S.
title: Azimuth / strike inaccurate

author: A Google User
comment: Can't wait to get out and use this propertly. Though a few instructions would be good.
title: This is an amazing app.

author: A Google User
comment: Had some problems

author: A Google User
comment: Excellent app... Helps a lot on field works.
title: Awesome

author: A Google User
comment: I Just bought an android coz this stuff
title: Excellent

author: A Google User
comment: I recently purchased a german made CLAR compass which measures Dip and Dip Direction. It cost $2700 AUD. Wish I had seen this app first! This app has very acceptable level of accuracy for my job (Geotechnical Engineer) and also has a very nice mode where you can plot your measurments on a satelite view of the area. Taking measurements is also many times faster than using a traditional geological comapss. This App is Really Impressive !!
title: This App is Amazing

author: A Google User
comment: I also agree with Jesse about being able to take pictures. More than one would be nice too. Also, if you could make a function to switch between quadrant and azimuth, that would be awesome. Also, I've been playing around, but it seems to be giving me some wonky readings. I need to check with a brunton, but I'll let you know. It could be my phone too. We'll see. Great app, though!
title: Tentative Review

author: A Google User
comment: Great app for rock engineers. I like the photo number tagging idea, but would also add more joint info data like JRC/ RMR worksheets.

author: A Google User
comment: The app I needed..

author: A Google User
comment: Thanks!
title: Good simple software

author: A Google User
comment: If you're a geologist, don't even hesitate to add this invaluable tool to your kit. PS ability to record magsus data will make iphone geos jealous.

author: A Google User
comment: Great app, installed it the morning of our geomechanics field trip, by the end of the day wed given up on the normal compass as too slow and laborious

author: A Google User
comment: Great app but not yet good enough to replace compass clino. All the app needs is a better averaging of compass direction.

author: A Google User
comment: A logical development would be for stereonets to be included in the Rocklogger software bundle enabling quick determinations of planar and linear trends of the collected data. When stereonets,rose diagrams, maps and image capabilities are added it will achieve a 5 star rating!
title: Stereonets

author: A Google User
comment: Latest updates are great, keep em coming, great app

author: A Google User
comment: working great
